Subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Is REST Winning?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=189321215; y=5itLtSxVqCTSyCHIBAl86lM9zY9E-Dq4gTjPTsobP4HDvker6WbyhBOx

On 5/31/07, Bill de hOra <bill@...> wrote:
>
> I've seen arrant nonsense around transactions ...

+1

> ... binding, service descriptions ...

+1 with nobs on

> ... basically interpreting REST to mean whatever one wants to
> mean ... it simply won't do for a well-documented style.

The truth is that it is non-trivial to transfer a mindset from RPC /
WS-* / etc to REST - it was interesting to hear Tim Ewald say "I
finally get REST. Wow." because that is the personal reaction you can
see when 'the light switches on' and the worldview shifts.

> The technical value
> needs to be squarely protected from vendors, analysts marketing
> departments and on-the-wagon rpc coders.

*sigh* methinks that'll happen whatever we do!

> I've set my bozo bit for WS and SOA types who are repositioning
> themselves as REST stalwarts. Spotting a bandwagons is not an indicator
> of competence.

/me nods

But, at the same time, let's not let the door slam shut in the face of
those, like Tim, who are really getting onboard with the style.

Regards,
Alan Dean
http://thoughtpad.net/alan-dean
